item.title: Bybit and Cactus Custody Announce Strategic Partnership, Cactus Oasis Officially Integrated into Bybit PlatformBybit has announced a strategic partnership with Cactus Custody, a compliant and licensed digital asset custody institution under the Matrixport Group. The two parties will launch a new over-the-counter settlement solution through the Cactus Oasis platform, aiming to improve the asset security and capital utilization efficiency of institutional clients. It is reported that institutional clients can托管their assets in regulated independent accounts and only transfer them to the exchange at the time of settlement, without the need for pre-funding. The solution is also equipped with risk control mechanisms, including dual authorization and pre-authorization models, and strictly complies with regulatory requirements. Cactus Custody holds a Hong Kong Monetary Authority TCSP license, and this integration will be officially launched on July 28.

At the same time, Binance will terminate the spot trading bot services for the above trading pairs. Users can still trade the relevant currencies on other available trading pairs. (This news flash is generated with the assistance of AI) [Odaily News]

item.title: Bitget launches ETH Spot Copy Trading, enjoy cashback and 10% APR subsidyTo celebrate the 10th anniversary of ETH, Bitget has launched an ETH Savings activity. During the event, new users who create a Savings Plan for the first time and invest at least 100 USDT in ETH will receive a 10% cashback on the investment amount, with a maximum cashback amount of 100 USDT and a total prize pool of 10,000 USDT. [Foresight News]

item.title: Is Citigroup eyeing stablecoin issuance? Here’s what we knowCitigroup claims to be exploring stablecoin adoption amidst accelerated regulations in the United States and Hong Kong to accommodate. How far are they willing to dive? Major financial institutions are now seeking opportunities to benefit from the current stablecoin wave that’s been sweeping the globe. Companies in Hong Kong and the United States have expressed interest in issuing their own stablecoins pegged to local currencies. The global banking firm Citigroup is no exception. In a recent earnings call, CEO Jane Fraser said to stakeholders that the bank is currently aiming to delve deeper into stablecoins and digital assets in order to fulfill clients’ needs. In addition, the bank also hopes to attract new clients and unlock new revenue streams through stablecoins. These comments are reaffirmed by New York-based head of services at Citigroup, Shahmir Khaliq in an interview with South China Morning Post. The executive called stablecoins a “global phenomenon,” especially with recent developments in the United States and Hong Kong’s own Stablecoin Ordinance bill that is scheduled to come into effect on August 1. “We welcome regulators providing us guidance and insight on the stablecoin landscape, allowing us to continue developing new services that help our clients run their businesses every day,” said Khaliq. How far do you think banks are willing to go to embrace stablecoins? Earlier this year, the banking group expressed interest in offering technology-based services and the issuance of what they called a “Citi stablecoin.” Recently, it has also stated that its plans to help clients navigate reserve management as stablecoins require backing its value in reserves. It would also offer services that could convert stablecoins into fiat currencies and vice versa. “Consumers and companies will have multiple payment options, and ultimately, the adoption of stablecoins will depend on factors like cost and ease of access,” he said, adding that banks are able to provide the bridge between stablecoins and fiat. Although the bank is undoubtedly curious about stablecoins and how they will be able to make use of them, it is also taking a cautious stance as it observes the need for “clear accounting rules regarding stablecoins and their impact on balance sheets and liquidity” according to Khaliq. He believes that there is still a long way to go before true regulatory clarity can be achieved in terms of stablecoins, stating that it is still “very early” in its development. Back in April 2025, Citigroup’s latest report showed that stablecoin issuers are poised to become some of the largest holders of U.S. Treasuries by 2030 if the U.S. adopts a regulatory framework. Now that it has, only time will tell if it will reach the predicted $1 trillion surge in additional demand for U.S. Treasuries. Most recently, the Trump Administration passed the Guiding and Establishing National Innovation for U.S. Stablecoins Act or GENIUS Act. It received majority vote from the House of Representatives on July 18. The bill is aimed at providing the first federal framework for stablecoins. Hong Kong is next in line. The special administrative region recently passed the Stablecoin Ordinance, which mandates companies to register for a stablecoin issuance license in order to offer services and issue stablecoins pegged to the Hong Kong dollar. It is scheduled to come into effect on August 1. Even China has begun to mull over softening its stance on digital assets as more and more countries are competing to issue their own stablecoins linked to local currencies, in an attempt to overthrow USD-pegged stablecoin dominance. [Citigroup]

item.title: The number of ETH queued for unstaking has increased to nearly 620,000.According to on-chain analyst Ai Yi's monitoring, the number of ETH queued for unstaking has increased to nearly 620,000, with net redemptions reaching 271,000. On-chain data shows that in the past week, two HTX-related wallets have cumulatively redeemed 110,000 ETH, with a total value of over $400 million. In addition, institutions such as Abraxas Capital Mgmt have also carried out staking redemptions. [Odaily News]

item.title: Bitget Wallet Launches "Scan Chain Product Experience Officer" Recruitment ProgramBitget Wallet has announced the launch of a "Scan Chain Product Experience Officer" recruitment campaign, which will recruit 300 users from the Chinese community to become "Scan Chain Product Promoters" by sharing their experiences using the Bitget Wallet scan chain function to discover meme potential coins. The event will run from July 23 to August 1. Participants need to use the Bitget Wallet scan chain function and publish tweets to share the process of screening potential coins and their personal experiences. [Odaily News]

item.title: ChainCatcher announces a partnership with Volcano Engine to drive the efficient development of Web3 infrastructure.ChainCatcher has announced a partnership with Volcengine to assist Volcengine in promoting its cloud computing services, including cloud servers, storage, and enterprise-level solutions. Through this collaboration, both parties will jointly promote the efficient development of Web3 infrastructure. As an influential media platform in the Web3 field, ChainCatcher's collaboration will combine its industry resources with Volcengine's technical advantages to provide Web3 companies with more efficient cloud service support. As a leading global cloud computing service provider, Volcengine's collaboration will further strengthen its presence in Web3 and emerging technology fields. [ChainCatcher]

item.title: CryptoQuant analyst: Ethereum may experience a pullback in the short term, but the magnitude and duration are not expected to be too largeOn July 23, CryptoQuant analyst Crypto Dan said that Ethereum has recently risen sharply and may experience a correction in the short term, but the magnitude and duration are not expected to be too large. He pointed out that compared with the overheated market in March and November 2024, the current market is not high. Although Ethereum has performed slowly in this cycle, it has bottomed out and may continue to rise in the second half of 2025. He also mentioned that the rise of Ethereum often drives the performance of other currencies, and investors can pay attention to the subsequent market trends. [PANews]

item.title: Matrixport: Crypto market faces short-term volatility, but overall uptrend is not overMatrixport released a chart today stating that Bitcoin's open interest has increased significantly by $6.00B in the past two weeks, and the annualized funding rate has soared to 19.00%, indicating a large number of aggressive leveraged long positions in the market. At the same time, the activity of South Korean retail investors has increased significantly, and cryptocurrency trading volume has jumped from $1.00B to $6.00B, reflecting the dominant role of retail funds in this round of market conditions. However, as prices enter a sideways phase, these highly leveraged long positions may face the risk of passive liquidation, especially after next week's FOMC meeting, when the market will enter a relatively quiet August trading period. Despite short-term volatility pressure, multiple key positives are building momentum for after the summer, and the overall upward trend in the crypto market is not over. [Odaily]

item.title: Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba Denies Reports of His ResignationAccording to Jinshi, Shigeru Ishiba, the Japanese Prime Minister, told the media on the afternoon of July 23 that the Japanese media's reports about his resignation were "completely without factual basis." Ishiba said that he had just finished meetings with Taro Aso, the top advisor of the Liberal Democratic Party, former Prime Minister Yoshihide Suga, and Fumio Kishida, and "the issue of resignation was not discussed." Media reports about his intention to resign are completely untrue. Ishiba reiterated that he will remain in office and continue to govern. [Foresight News]

[Wu Blockchain]
